state.full: You’re full if you’ve eaten your fill. You can’t eat any more food while full.
state.sated: You’re sated if you’ve eaten recently but you’ve still got room for a bit more.
state.hungry: You’re hungry if your stomach is growling and you’re starting to feel a bit weak.
state.peckish: You’re peckish if you’re ready for your next meal
state.starving: You’re starving if everything reminds you of food and you’re feeling weak and tired

effect.full: After an hour of being full, you become sated.
effect.sated: After eight hours of being peckish, you become hungry.
effect.hungry: After sixteen hours of being hungry, you gain 1 Fatigue and become starving.
effect.peckish: After sixteen hours of being hungry, you gain 1 Fatigue and become starving.
effect.starving: For every day you are starving, you gain 1 Fatigue.

effect.quenched: After an hour of being quenched, you become hydrated.
effect.hydrated: After two hours of being sated, you become thirsty.
effect.thirsty: After four hours of being thirsty, you gain 1 Fatigue and become dehydrated.
effect.dehydrated: Every eight hours you spend dehydrated, gain 1 Fatigue.

effect.rested: After eight hours rested, you become tired.
effect.tired: After eight hours tired, you gain 1 Fatigue and become weary.
effect.weary: After eight hours weary, you gain 1 Fatigue and become exhausted.
effect.exhausted: Every four hours exhausted, you gain 1 Fatigue.
